intro: Hemipilia omeishanica, commonly known as the Omeishan lily, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers with a white throat. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in mountainous regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, while its inflorescence consists of a single flower stem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Hemipilia omeishanica is considered an endangered species.
